intro: Henlea muzonensis, commonly known as the Muzon's henlea, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and produces small, clustered flowers with four petals. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in montane forests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
